intro: Gynotroches micrantha var. tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate gynotroches, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, tuberculate (bumpy) leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
